purpose.summary: This policy establishes governance standards for Sales Performance Incentive Funds (SPIFs), sales contests, and short-term promotional incentive programs at the Company. The policy ensures SPIFs are strategically aligned, financially controlled, do not conflict with base compensation plans, and comply with legal and regulatory requirements.
objectives: Establish governance standards for SPIFs, sales contests, and short-term promotional incentive programs
Ensure SPIFs are strategically aligned and financially controlled
Prevent conflicts between SPIFs and base compensation plans
Comply with legal and regulatory requirements
Provide clear approval thresholds and authority levels

appliesTo: All short-term incentive programs with duration less than one fiscal year
Product-specific, customer segment, or activity-based SPIFs
Sales contests with monetary or non-monetary awards
All divisions, business units, and sales roles within the Company

definitions.definition: A short-term incentive program designed to drive specific sales behaviors, product sales, or strategic initiatives over a limited time period (typically 1-12 weeks).
A competitive program where participants compete against each other for awards based on relative performance rankings.
An incentive program that runs concurrently with base compensation plans, providing incremental rewards for specified activities or outcomes.
The primary annual or ongoing commission/bonus plan that defines core compensation structure.
A situation where a SPIF creates perverse incentives that contradict or undermine base plan objectives.
The financial return generated by a SPIF relative to its total cost, calculated as incremental profit divided by program cost.

provisions.title: SPIF Approval Thresholds and Authority
provisions.content: SPIF approval requirements are based on total program cost and potential business impact.

provisions.title: SPIF Design Standards
provisions.content: Standards governing the design and structure of all SPIF programs.

subProvisions.title: Duration Requirements
items: Recommended duration: 4-8 weeks for optimal impact
Programs exceeding 12 weeks must be incorporated into base compensation plans

subProvisions.title: Eligibility Standards
items: Must be open to all reps in defined segment (no selective participation)
Eligibility criteria must be objective and measurable
New hires within 90 days may be excluded or given prorated targets

subProvisions.title: Performance Measures
subProvisions.content: SPIFs must have clear, measurable performance criteria:
items: Specific products, services, or customer segments
Measurable outcomes (revenue, units, new customers, activities)

subProvisions.title: Payout Structure
items: Tiered rewards based on achievement levels
Payout formula must be clearly documented
Maximum individual award must be defined
Total program budget must include worst-case scenario

subProvisions.title: Communication Requirements
items: Start and end dates (specific dates, not 'one month')

subProvisions.title: Individual Participation Limits
subProvisions.content: Total SPIF earnings for any individual sales rep are capped at:
items: 25% of annual base compensation per quarter
50% of annual target incentive per fiscal year
Earnings exceeding these caps require Compensation Review Board approval

subProvisions.title: Aggregate Budget Controls
items: Total SPIF spending across all programs: Not to exceed 5% of total sales compensation budget
Division-level SPIF budgets approved annually by Finance
Monthly SPIF spending reports to Finance
Budget overruns require SVP Sales and CFO approval

subProvisions.title: Vendor-Funded SPIFs
subProvisions.content: SPIFs funded by manufacturers or vendors are subject to this policy:
items: Must be approved through same governance process
Vendor funding does not bypass approval requirements
Legal review required for all vendor-funded programs >$25K
Must comply with anti-kickback and transparency regulations
Vendor relationship must be disclosed to participants

provisions.title: ROI Measurement Requirements
provisions.content: Requirements for measuring return on investment for SPIF programs.

subProvisions.title: Pre-Program ROI Projection
subProvisions.content: All SPIFs over $50,000 must include projected ROI analysis:

subProvisions.title: Post-Program ROI Analysis
subProvisions.content: Within 45 days of program completion, program owner must provide:
items: Programs failing to achieve 2:1 ROI require explanation and corrective action plan for future programs

provisions.title: Conflict Avoidance with Base Compensation Plans
provisions.content: Rules to prevent SPIFs from conflicting with base compensation plan objectives.

subProvisions.title: Prohibited Conflicts
items: Incentivize behavior that reduces base plan earnings
Create incentive to defer sales to different time periods
Encourage product mix that reduces overall profitability
Contradict strategic objectives of base plans
Create incentives to manipulate timing of order booking

subProvisions.title: Conflict Assessment Checklist
items: How does this SPIF align with base plan objectives?
Could reps earn more by gaming timing or product mix?
Does this SPIF reward activities already compensated in base plans?
What behaviors might be de-prioritized due to this SPIF?
How will we measure if SPIF creates unintended consequences?

subProvisions.title: Stacking Limits
subProvisions.content: To prevent excessive layering of SPIFs:
items: Maximum of 3 concurrent SPIFs per sales rep
SPIFs on same product/customer segment must be additive, not duplicative
Total potential SPIF earnings must be tracked against caps

provisions.title: Documentation and Tracking Requirements
provisions.content: Requirements for registering and tracking all SPIF programs.

subProvisions.title: SPIF Registration
subProvisions.content: All SPIFs must be registered in the central SPIF tracking system before launch:

subProvisions.title: Financial Tracking
items: Budget vs. actual spending by program
Accruals for programs spanning month/quarter end

subProvisions.title: Retention Period
subProvisions.content: All SPIF documentation retained for seven (7) years: program rules, approvals, participant data, payment records, and ROI analyses.

subProvisions.title: Payment Timing Standards
subProvisions.content: Payment deadlines based on program size:
items: SPIFs under $50K total budget: Pay within 30 days of program end
SPIFs over $50K: Pay within 45 days of program end (allows for verification)
Vendor-funded SPIFs: Pay within 30 days of receiving vendor payment

subProvisions.title: Tax Treatment
subProvisions.content: All SPIF payments are taxable compensation subject to:
items: Federal and state income tax withholding
Reporting on W-2 as supplemental wages
Non-cash awards reported at fair market value

provisions.title: Roles and Responsibilities
provisions.content: Clearly defined roles for all parties involved in SPIF governance.

subProvisions.title: Business Sponsors/Product Managers
items: Identify business objectives requiring SPIF support
Prepare business case and ROI projection

subProvisions.title: Sales Compensation Team
items: Review SPIF proposals for policy compliance
Assess conflict with base compensation plans
Provide quarterly SPIF reporting to leadership

subProvisions.title: Finance
items: Review and approve SPIF budgets per thresholds

subProvisions.title: Legal
items: Review program rules for legal risks
Advise on tax treatment of non-cash awards

subProvisions.title: Sales Leadership
items: Monitor for unintended consequences or gaming
